meanings.definition: Adonises: plural form of adonis, a very handsome young man
meanings.sent1: In the play, the two adonises captured everyone's attention with their striking looks.
meanings.sent2: The adonises at the party were the center of admiration and envy.
meanings.sent3: The adonises in the movie were so good-looking that they made the audience swoon.
meanings.sent4: He was like one of those adonises from a romantic novel, with chiseled features and a charming smile.
meanings.sent5: The adonises in the magazine spread set unrealistic beauty standards for young men.

meanings.definition: Adonises: third person singular present of adonise, to make someone or something attractive or beautiful
meanings.sent1: She adonises her garden by planting colorful flowers and arranging them beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The stylist adonises the models before they walk the runway, enhancing their natural beauty.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother adonises Cinderella for the royal ball, transforming her rags into a stunning gown.
meanings.sent4: His charisma adonises every room he enters, making him the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: The artist adonises the plain canvas with vibrant colors, turning it into a masterpiece.
